intro: Consolida orientalis var. thessalonica, commonly known as the Balkan sweet rocket, is a flowering plant native to the Balkan Peninsula. It belongs to the family Papaveraceae and is characterized by its delicate, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with slender stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The plant is often found in meadows, woodland edges, and rocky areas, thriving in well-drained soil.
